snippet: In “Rodney King,” Roger Guenveur Smith pays a nuanced tribute to the man whose 1991 beating by police officers proved a seminal moment in contemporary race relations.
abstract: Eric Grode reviews Roger Guenveur Smith stage monologue Rodney King as part of Under the Radar Festival at Public Theater.
lead_paragraph: In “Rodney King,” Roger Guenveur Smith pays a nuanced tribute to the man whose 1991 beating by police officers proved a seminal moment in contemporary race relations.

headline.seo: Exploring Rodney King’s Struggles in a Stage Monologue
headline.main: A Flawed Man as Lightning Rod and Empathetic Stumbler
headline.print_headline: Delving Into the Struggles of a Flawed Man Turned Flashpoint
